p: Random brownian particle trajectories were generated using the script package msdanalzer [ 58] incorporated into a custom MatLab routine. Single virus trajectories were analyzed as described above. Trajectory and sub-trajectory analysis was performed using msdanalzer to retrieve diffusion coefficients from mean square displacement (MSD, <r 2>) vs. lag-time (Δt) plots. MSD vs. lag-time plots were fitted according to the type of motional behavior, which was either free diffusion (<r 2> = 4D freeΔt) or, for sub-trajectory analysis, confined (sub)diffusion (<r 2> = <r 2> (1-A 1exp (−4A 2D confΔt/<r2>)). We found for IAV a mean free diffusion coefficient D free = 0.041 μm 2/s.
